intro: Dendroportulaca, commonly known as the tree spurge, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its succulent, often spiny stems and leaves, which are adapted to arid environments. The plants typically produce small, yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Dendroportulaca species are native to regions of Africa, South America, and parts of Asia. They are often found growing in rocky or sandy soils, and some species can form shrubs or even small trees.
